column5: I was wondering if anyone here knows whether the Pond at Centennial Park in Etobicoke is permitted for fishing. I heard conflicting reports that it is a wildlife habitat and prohibited for fishing. Others have said that people are allowed to fish there. Does anyone know whether this pond is open or closed for fishing?
GO for real fish . Hit the Humber river get a rainbow trout  for dinner .Best spot is at the   (OLD MILL)   BLOOR north to DUNDAS STREET. GOOD LUCK.
There's something about the humber and dinner that just doesn't seem right.... Yes you can fish the Ponds at the hill.
Stay away from the DAM.  Good call Andy.
Well ... lets just say ... I can walk there .... but I don't
visted the credit and the humber. high, muddy, fast.  wait a couple of more weeks. just around the same time i get my gimp boot taken off
the place is useless, just carp hybrids and 4" catfish in there. But yes you can fish there
